message: The state of federal law is, in part, a product of a complex array of processes by which federal statutes and regulations are codified. Even for a seasoned attorney, the process by which finalized statutes and regulations make their way into the public domain is shrouded in mystery!

You are invited to join Justia Webinars and Cornell Law School Legal Information Institute Co-Directors Craig Newton and Sara Frug as they explore the nuances of codification and how challenges in the process impact the free law movement. How Laws Get Online: Challenges in Free Law begins promptly at 2:00 p.m. ET/11:00 a.m. PT on Friday, September 8, 2023.
bottomline: Free Registration Now Available. Claim Your Seat Before It’s Gone!
note: Please note: This presentation is accredited for one hour of General MCLE credit in California. If you want CLE credit, you will need to upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to take advantage of this exclusive benefit.

message: Want to better understand the intricate world of federal statutes, regulations, and their place in the public domain? Tomorrow, we are hosting an exclusive webinar unraveling some of the complexities surrounding statutes and regulations, legal research platforms, copyright, and the future of AI-Powered legal tools.

You are invited to join Justia Webinars and Cornell Law School Legal Information Institute Co-Directors Craig Newton and Sara Frug for How Laws Get Online: Challenges in Free Law, beginning promptly at 2:00 p.m. ET/11:00 a.m. PT tomorrow.
bottomline: Sign up for this insightful program before time runs out!

message: Hi Name,

message: Thank you for joining us for our recent Justia Webinars presentation, How Laws Get Online: Challenges in Free Law. We love connecting our members with new learning opportunities and hope you found the webinar both engaging and informative.
As we continue to plan future Justia Webinars for Justia Connect members, we want to hear from you! If you have not already done so, please share your feedback about your recent webinar experience.
